div.p: Constellation Schools provides every child an opportunity to obtain an excellent education built on a foundation of character education for life long success.

p.span: Please click the following link to view weekly updates, assignments, and other information provided by your teachers. There's also access to a virtual career fair.

strong.span:
Call Center for COVID-19/Coronavirus
Ohio Department of Health
1-833-4-ASK-ODH
strong.br:
Open seven days a week from 9:00 AM - 8:00 PM
For the general public regarding questions about Coronavirus
Cuyahoga County established a helpline for residents who have general questions about Coronavirus. This helpline is in addition to the Ohio Department of Health's call center.

strong.span:
COVID CareLine for Mental Health Support
Ohio Department of Mental Health and Addiction Services
1-800-720-9616
strong.br:
Open seven days a week from 8:00 AM - 8:00 PM
This toll-free, confidential careline provides emotional support to individuals who may be struggling to cope with current challenges in their lives.

br.span: Please click the following link to view resources provided by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and the Ohio Department of Health regarding the Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19), including multilingual resources.
Please click the following link to view information and resources provided by Constellation Schools to assist your family during the school closure.

strong.span: View Community Resources During the Closure

br.span: Please click the following link to view resources provided by the Detroit Shoreway Community Development Organization and Cudell Improvement, Inc. These resources include health information, food, financial assistance, education for children, and a list of restaurants offering delivery or take-out.

div.h1: From the Desk of Principal Lester...

img.title: Ms. Lester, Principal
img.style: float: right; margin-top: 5px; margin-left: 7px; width: 24%; height: 37%;

p.img: Welcome to the homepage of Constellation Schools: Madison Community Elementary! For the past 15 years, we have been proud to serve the families in our area. We are located just blocks from the Cudell neighborhood and have developed many local community partners! Madison Mustangs are a team of educators working in harmony to provide an excellent education, built on the foundation of character education for lifelong success.

div.p: As a Mustang, your child’s needs come first! We strive to build a community that is inclusive of all students. At Madison your child will be surrounded by educators that are passionate about education but even more passionate about helping your child find success! Our staff is known to create a positive, safe environment with high expectations where all students are able to take risks, learn new things, and create relationships that will last a lifetime.

Madison Community offers a technology rich environment that prepares young minds for the ever changing world around us. Our classrooms are equipped with technology such as SmartBoards, document cameras, and touch screen devices. With our 1:1 laptop initiative for 2nd-8th grade, students will learn skills necessary for success in career, college, and life.

Character Education is a foundational cornerstone in our educational program as we prepare our students for their future. Our school operates on a foundation of mutual respect and communication between students, families, and Madison staff.
We also offer a wide range of after-school activities including (but not limited to) tutoring, coed basketball, coed volleyball, coed cheerleading, cooking club, and sign-language club.

Come visit Constellation Schools: Madison Community Elementary and you will be glad you did! If you have any questions, concerns, or comments - please call 216-651-5212 - we would be happy to speak to you and add to our Mustang family!

p.br: SaferOH tip line will allow students and adults to anonymously share information with school officials and law enforcement about threats to student safety - whether that involved threatened mass incident or harm of a single student.

div.p: Constellation Schools: Madison Community Elementary does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, or age in its programs and activities and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. The following person has been designated to handle inquiries regarding non-discrimination policies:
